meanings.definition: Dark, gloomy, or threatening in appearance
meanings.sent1: The sky looked loury, with heavy clouds blocking the sun.
meanings.sent2: The forest became loury as the sun set, casting long shadows.
meanings.sent3: Even the cheerful flowers seemed loury under the stormy sky.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as loury as the overcast sky, full of hidden thunder.
meanings.sent5: The old haunted house had a loury atmosphere, sending shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: To frown or scowl in an angry or threatening manner
meanings.sent1: He louried at me when I accidentally bumped into him.
meanings.sent2: The teacher louried at the noisy students to quiet down.
meanings.sent3: The cat louried at the dog who dared to enter its territory.
meanings.sent4: She louried at the rude customer, ready to defend her coworker.
meanings.sent5: As the storm approached, the sailor louried at the darkening sky, preparing for rough seas.
